cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to finish its west-to-west-northwest drift today, then make a sharp turn north toward Hispaniola late Tuesday before curving into the Atlantic east of the Bahamas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch posted only for Turks & Caicos and the north–east Dominican Republic coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to the entire south coasts of the Dominican Republic and Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts focused on Hispaniola, with lesser peripheral effects over Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy (20–30 mph) squalls possible Tuesday night–Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected around St. Croix; surge focused near Hispaniola land-fall area
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain, locally 4 inches, Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional lightning in outer rain-bands; minor short-period swells in the Caribbean passage
